meanings.definition: Not candid or sincere, typically by pretending that one knows less about something than one really does.
meanings.sent1: She gave a disingenuous smile when asked about her knowledge of the topic.
meanings.sent2: His disingenuous behavior made it hard to trust him.
meanings.sent3: It was disingenuous of him to act clueless about the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The politician's disingenuous promises left the voters feeling deceived.
meanings.sent5: The salesman's disingenuous pitch failed to convince the skeptical customers.

meanings.definition: Not straightforward or honest; insincere or calculating.
meanings.sent1: The disingenuous student pretended not to know the answer to avoid being called on.
meanings.sent2: Her disingenuous apology did not seem genuine.
meanings.sent3: It was disingenuous of the cat to act innocent after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The disingenuous smile on his face revealed his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The disingenuous tactics of the competitor were quickly exposed by the vigilant team.
